intro: Geranium cinereum var. subacutum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It features upright stems that are often hairy, and its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a distinctive blue-green color. The flowers are typically pink to purple, borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. This plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
